name: Yuanqing Zheng
content: Welcome to Yuanqing's page Yuanqing Zheng (郑元庆) Associate Professor Department of Computing The Hong Kong Polytechnic University Office: PQ721, Mong Man Wai Building Phone: (852) 2766 7288 Fax: (852) 2766 0842 Email: csyqzheng@comp.polyu.edu.hk Hiring We are looking for PolyU Ug/Pg student helpers, PhD students, research staffs in all levels to work on exciting research projects related to Internet of Things, wireless sensing, ubiquitous computing, embedded systems, security and privacy, robotics, and artificial intelligence. If you are interested in any of these or other research topics, please feel free to contact me. Biography Yuanqing Zheng is an associate professor in the Department of Computing, the Hong Kong Polytechnic University. Previously, he was an assistant professor in the same department during 2014-2020. He received the Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. He received the B.S. degree in Electrical Engineering and the M.E. degree in Communication and Information System both from Beijing Normal University, Beijing, China. He is/was on the editorial board of Proceedings of the ACM on Interactive, Mobile, Wearable and Ubiquitous Technologies (ACM IMWUT), ACM Transactions on Sensor Networks (ACM TOSN), Computer Networks, and IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications (IEEE TWC). He is a Senior Member of IEEE and a Member of ACM. Teaching 2024/2025-Sem 2: COMP1011 - Programming Fundamentals Research Interests Internet of Things, Wireless Networking, Ubiquitous Computing, Embedded AI Recent Publications (full list) IoT and Wireless Networking (LoRa, LPWAN): [SIGCOMM'25] Ziyue Zhang, Xianjin Xia, Ruonan Li, Yuanqing Zheng, “Towards Next-Generation Global IoT: Empowering Massive Connectivity with Harmonious Multi-Network Coexistence”, In ACM SIGCOMM, 2025, (PDF).
